Article Title: IND vs ENG 4th Test: â€˜Forever grateful to youâ€™ - Washington Sundarâ€™s heartfelt post after first Test ton captures hearts
Article Text:
Ravindra Jadeja of India celebrates reaching his century with Washington Sundar during Day Five of the 4th Test vs England (Photo by Clive Mason/Getty Images)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Ben Stokes press conference: On handshake controversy, India fightback, his own fitness

Washington Sundar on X (Screengrab)

Poll What do you think was the key factor in India's remarkable draw at Old Trafford? Washington Sundar's performance Ravindra Jadeja's contribution Team's ability to absorb pressure England's missed opportunities

â€œGrateful for the people, and forever grateful to you, God,â€ wrote Washington Sundar on X after scoring his maiden Test hundred â€” a composed, unbeaten 101* that helped India pull off a dramatic draw against England in the fourth Test at Old Trafford.The 25-year-old all-rounderâ€™s quiet gratitude came after a loud statement on the field, where he and Ravindra Jadeja (107) batted through the final phase of Day 5 to rescue India from what once looked like certain defeat. Reduced to 0/2 at the start of their second innings, India needed a miracle. They found it in the form of a rock-solid batting effort, with Shubman Gill (103) and KL Rahul (90) also playing key roles.The final session was filled with tension â€” Englandâ€™s frustration began to show, especially after Jadeja launched a six off Harry Brook to reach his hundred. In a curious moment, Brook stepped forward with a handshake offer, seemingly looking to wrap up the game.But Sundar , just short of his own milestone, ignored the gesture and carried on. The image of Brookâ€™s puzzled smile and Sundarâ€™s calm focus summed up the psychological edge India held at the end.This was just the second draw for England in 40 Tests under Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum, which was a rare occurrence in their aggressive â€˜Bazballâ€™ era. But it was a deserved result for India, whose batters absorbed immense pressure to ensure the series stays alive at 2-1.With the possibility of leveling the series still on the line, the stage is set for a cracking finale at The Oval. But for now, Sundarâ€™s words and his resolve linger as the high point of a chaotic final day.
Article Summary: Washington sundar scored 101* to help india draw 4th test at old trafford. Ravindra jadeja (107) and shubman gill (103) also made centuries. The draw means the series is level at 2-1 with a game to play at the oval.

Article Title: NHL Trade Rumors: Nazem Kadri could join Montreal Canadiens after Toronto Maple Leafs blocked by Calgary Flames
Article Text:
Bill Wippert/Getty

Calgary Flames shut door on Toronto Maple Leafs, Nazem Kadri eyes Montreal Canadiens as realistic trade option

Montreal Canadiens could land reliable veteran Nazem Kadri with proven scoring punch and leadership

FAQs:

1. How many Stanley Cups has Nazem Kadri won?

2. When was Nazem Kadri drafted and by which team?

Nazem Kadri may be headed back to the Eastern Conference, and the Montreal Canadiens could be the front-runners. With Calgary reportedly refusing to negotiate any trades with the Toronto Maple Leafs, Kadriâ€™s list of potential destinations has effectively narrowed to just one team. Given his consistent production and Montrealâ€™s need for veteran help up the middle, this could be a perfect short-term fit. His playoff experience, leadership qualities, and gritty playing style could also provide the young Canadiens roster with a much-needed edge as they continue their rebuild.Nazem Kadri is reportedly open to a trade to either the Montreal Canadiens or his former team, the Toronto Maple Leafs. However, with Calgary Flames management unwilling to make a deal with Toronto, still harboring friction from Brad Trelivingâ€™s tenure as Flames GM that path appears closed.Sportsnetâ€™s Nick Kypreos reported that Treliving has previously tried to acquire players like Chris Tanev, Nikita Zadorov, and Rasmus Andersson from Calgary, but has been shut down at every turn. That history makes it highly unlikely that the Flames would greenlight any trade that sends Kadri back to the Maple Leafs.This leaves the Canadiens as the only viable trade destination Kadri would reportedly consider. Montrealâ€™s growing core, including top prospect Ivan Demidov and head coach Martin St. Louisâ€™ high-skill system could make the Canadiens an appealing spot for the 34-year-old centerman.Kadri is coming off back-to-back seasons of 67 and 75 points, playing a full 82 games in both campaigns. He has tallied 710 points in 985 NHL games and once posted a 100-point pace during the 2021â€“22 season with Colorado. At 6-foot and 185 pounds, Kadri brings experience, physicality, and versatility to any middle-six unit.With Montrealâ€™s top prospect Michael Hage still developing, Kadri could be a strong short-term option to stabilize the Canadiens' second line alongside Demidov. His leadership and playoff pedigree would be especially valuable to a young team looking to take the next step.If Calgary refuses to deal with Toronto, the road is clear for the Montreal Canadiens to pursue Nazem Kadri. Given his proven scoring ability and desire for a fresh start, a move to Montreal could benefit both sides, if the price is right. As trade rumors heat up, the Canadiens may quietly be positioning themselves for a bold veteran addition.Kadri won one Stanley Cup with the Colorado Avalanche during the 2021â€“22 NHL season.Kadri was drafted 7th overall by the Toronto Maple Leafs in the 2009 NHL Draft.Also Read: NHL Trade Rumors: Kyle Connor likely to re-sign as Winnipeg Jets pursue long-term contract extension amid NHL free agency buzz
Article Summary: Nazem kadri is reportedly open to a trade to either the montreal canadiens or his former team, the toronto maple leafs. Calgary flames management unwilling to make a deal with toronto, still harboring friction from brad trelivingâ€™s tenure as flames gm. The montreal canadiens could be the front-runners for the 34-year-old.

Article Title: â€œThis is toughâ€: Miami Dolphins CB Kader Kohou out for 2025 NFL season with knee injury, leaving secondary in crisis
Article Text:
Miami Dolphins CB Kader Kohou out for 2025 NFL season (Image via Getty)

Kader Kohouâ€™s season-ending injury hits hard for a defense already under rebuild pressure

Mike McDaniel finds hope in Kader Kohouâ€™s mindset: â€œThis is tough, but I guarantee Iâ€™m going to come back better.â€

Ashtyn Davisâ€™ scare adds to Dolphinsâ€™ stress, but McDaniel says â€œit wasnâ€™t the worst.â€

FAQs

Q1: How did Kader Kohou get injured?

Q2: Whatâ€™s the update on Ashtyn Davis?

Q3: Who replaces Kohou in the lineup?

The Miami Dolphinsâ€™ defense suffered a heartbreaking blow as cornerback Kader Kohou is now ruled out for the entire 2025 NFL season. He injured his knee during one-on-one drills Saturday and was helped off the field by medical staff. Just days later, safety Ashtyn Davis went down with a leg injury during Tuesdayâ€™s practice. While Davis is not out for the year, the back-to-back injuries have rattled the team ahead of preseason.This wasnâ€™t just another injury â€” it was Miamiâ€™s top nickel corner going down just as the defense was finding its new identity. Kohou was the lone returning starter in a reshuffled secondary and had looked sharp in early camp. His injury happened quickly during drills and left teammates visibly shaken. Coach Mike McDaniel confirmed Wednesday that heâ€™ll be placed on injured reserve.â€œI saw him ascend to a different level this offseason,â€ McDaniel told reporters. â€œThe timing of it â€” I was crushed until I talked to Kader.â€ Kohou, who entered the league as an undrafted free agent in 2022, had earned every inch of his starting role. Losing him just as he was peaking made the news all the more difficult for the team to absorb.McDanielâ€™s tone was emotional, not just as a coach, but as someone who clearly respects Kohou as a person. â€œKader made me feel a little bit better, simply by his mindset,â€ he said. â€œYou donâ€™t know the whys all the time when things happenâ€¦ Kaderâ€™s mindset triggered like that, to where he said, â€˜This is tough, but I guarantee Iâ€™m going to come back better.â€™â€ That resilience is what sticks.Miami wasted no time reacting â€” signing veteran cornerback Mike Hilton shortly after the injury. Hilton brings playoff experience from the Bengals and will help steady a shaken secondary. But truthfully, no one on the depth chart can fully replace Kohouâ€™s grit or leadership. The locker room felt the loss â€” and it wasnâ€™t just about Xs and Os.Then came Tuesday, and more bad news. Safety Ashtyn Davis suffered a left leg injury during practice and stayed down, punching the turf in frustration. Minutes later, he was seen on crutches and wearing a walking boot. That kind of scene never goes unnoticed at training camp â€” teammates looked stunned.Thankfully, Coach McDaniel later said the news wasnâ€™t catastrophic. â€œIt wasnâ€™t the worst,â€ he shared. Davis will be reevaluated in the coming days, and thereâ€™s hope heâ€™ll return before long. But paired with Kohouâ€™s injury, itâ€™s clear this wasnâ€™t the camp Miami had planned. Theyâ€™re already being tested â€” mentally and physically â€” before the season has even begun.Also read: Inside the NFLâ€™s preseason paychecks: How players earn, endure, and push toward the roster Kohou hurt his knee during one-on-one drills at Saturdayâ€™s practice and limped off with the teamâ€™s medical staff. Heâ€™s now out for the 2025 season.Davis suffered a left leg injury Tuesday. He returned to the locker room on crutches, but Coach McDaniel said it "wasnâ€™t the worst," and heâ€™s not out for the season.Miami signed Mike Hilton, a veteran corner with playoff experience, to help stabilize the secondary. Heâ€™s expected to fill the nickel role moving forward.
Article Summary: Miami dolphins cornerback kader kohou is out for the entire 2025 nfl season. He injured his knee during one-on-one drills saturday and was helped off the field by medical staff. Just days later, safety ashtyn davis went down with a leg injury during tuesdayâ€™s practice. Heâ€™s expected to fill the nickel role moving forward.

Article Title: Jonathan Kuminga rejects Golden State Warriorsâ€™ $45M offer amid ongoing restricted free agency talks
Article Text:
Jonathan Kuminga rejected Golden State Warriors (Image via Instagram / @jonathan_kuminga)

Golden State Warriors' contract standoff with Jonathan Kuminga continues amid restricted free agency complications

Jonathan Kuminga is now a free agent (Image via Instagram / @jonathan_kuminga)

ESPN recently released a detailed report of the current issues between Jonathan Kuminga and his latest team, the Golden State Warriors. This happened after weeks of rumors that the restricted free agent was in talks with several teams regarding possible deals. The team signed the pro NBA player to a four-year rookie deal after drafting him seventh overall in 2021. Now, the team made renewed push to retain Jonathan KumingaThis offseason, the Golden State Warriors have been forced to deal with Jonathan Kuminga who is still in restricted free agency while they try to find a solution. The franchise have undoubtedly been looking into sign-and-trade possibilities for the NBA player, but there aren't many possible suitors for the rookie forward, so Golden State Warriors probably have to just re-sign him in the end.According to ESPN's Shams Charania and Anthony Slater, they made another attempt this week to keep the former seventh-overall choice, but Jonathan Kuminga rejected an offer of $45 million spread over two years.ESPN wrote:"The Golden State Warriors made another push to retain Jonathan Kuminga over the past several days, but the restricted free agent is continuing to decline their two-year, $45 million contract offer, sources told ESPN on Wednesday.â€The report continued:"Kuminga's decision is due in large part to the Warriors' insistence on having a team option for the second season and their unwillingness to let him maintain the built-in no-trade clause, sources said."As per the analysts, the proposal's second year was a team choice, which was a major point of contention during those discussions. Additionally, the Golden State Warriors were not willing to uphold the deal's no-trade condition.The 22-year-old appears more keen on taking an offer away from the Bay Area since he had a disagreement with the team during the 2024â€“25 season. Since he is a restricted free agent and is said to be seeking a contract for $25â€“30 million a season, his departure from the Golden State Warriors is not ideal.While the team has provided the pro NBA idol with offers that are below his liking, the analysts further report that the 6â€™8 forward has received offers of up to $90 million over four years during negotiations with the Sacramento Kings and Phoenix Suns . Additionally, the Phoenix Suns also reportedly made â€˜the most lucrativeâ€™ push thus far.Also read: Jonathan Kuminga, Cam Thomas and Josh Giddey eye $30 million yearly deals as teams hesitate in free agency
Article Summary: Golden state warriors' contract standoff with jonathan kuminga continues. The team signed the pro nba player to a four-year rookie deal after drafting him seventh overall in 2021. The 22-year-old appears more keen on taking an offer away from the bay area since he had a disagreement with the team during the 2024â€“25 season.

Article Title: NHL trade update, with the Oilers out, could the Senators be Carter Hartâ€™s NHL comeback ticket?
Article Text:
NHL-Carter Hart (Credit: Getty Images)

NHL goalie Carter Hart reportedly draws interest from Ottawa Senators

NHL continues ban even after Carter Hart, others found not guilty



FAQs



Is Carter Hart cleared to play in the NHL?



Why are the Ottawa Senators interested in Carter Hart?



What happened in the 2018 WJC case?



Are other NHL teams interested in the cleared players?



In a surprising twist following the fallout of the 2018 World Junior Championship sexual assault case, NHL goalie Carter Hart may soon find himself back in contention, but not with the team he was once linked to. With the Edmonton Oilers reportedly uninterested, all signs now point toward another Canadian franchise stepping into the conversation: the Ottawa Senators.Last week, Hart and four other players, Michael McLeod, Alex Formenton, Dillon DubÃ©, and Cal Foote, were acquitted in the long-running WJC investigation. Despite being found not guilty, the National Hockey League (NHL) deemed the allegations â€œvery disturbingâ€. It issued an indefinite suspension against all five, rendering them ineligible to play until further review.But in a developing twist, speculation is mounting around the Ottawa Senators making a move. Reports suggest the franchise is monitoring Hartâ€™s situation closely and could extend a contract offer as soon as league permissions allow. Among the five exonerated players, Carter Hart is widely viewed as the most likely to make a successful return to the league.Legal and sports analysts alike believe that the road to reinstatement could open sooner than expected, especially if public and media sentiment shifts in Hartâ€™s favor. His willingness to testify in court may also play a role in rebuilding his professional image.No, the NHL has currently ruled Hart and four other players ineligible, pending further review.Hart is considered the most NHL-ready among the cleared players and may fill Ottawaâ€™s long-standing goaltending gap.Hart and four others were accused in a 2018 assault case but were found not guilty in court this month.Yes, reports suggest that a few NHL teams may be exploring options, particularly for Carter Hart and Michael McLeod.If the Ottawa Senators do make a move, theyâ€™ll be betting on both talent and time. Hart, once considered a top-tier goaltending prospect, still has years of NHL potential ahead.Also Read: Could the former Stanley Cup champion Evgeny Kuznetsov find new life with the Bruins, Canucks, or Avalanche?
Article Summary: Nhl goalie carter hart reportedly draws interest from ottawa senators. Hart and four others were accused in a 2018 assault case but were found not guilty in court this month. Hart is considered the most nhl-ready among the cleared players and may fill ottawa's long-standing goaltending gap.

Article Title: â€˜I Love Jimmyâ€™: Davante Adams Clears the Air With Former Teammate, Jimmy Garoppolo
Article Text:
Davante Adams makes a shocking confession about Jimmy Garoppolo: Image via X

Davante Adams Came Clean About His Past Relationship Dynamic With Jimmy Garoppolo

"I love Jimmy. It was never a personal thing,"

"It's been amazing, we've gotten to catch up and get on the same page. Obviously, that was just a dark moment in all of our lives. I think all of us were pretty miserable over there. We kind of caught up and laughed about it, and we've been making plays since we've been here."

Matthew Stafford is out with his recurring back issues at the start of the Rams' training camp, opening the avenue for veteran backup Jimmy Garoppolo to take over. He was visibly pissed at the Raiders for cutting Derek Carr to sign someone like Garoppolo for the long run. Even when the team eventually benched Jimmy later in 2023, Adams was the first to second that move.But the dust seems settled now. Adams blamed the Raidersâ€™ overall chaotic setup for their differences and assured it was never personal.Adams said on Sedano & Kap (via Michael David Smith of Pro Football Talk).The athletes will meet each other on the field from week1, although Garoppolo wonâ€™t start under the center. Whatever â€Œthe case, it will be interesting to see the former foes pairing up to topple the defenders.

Article Title: Bengals DE Trey Hendrickson ends holdout with 4-word contract update; Joe Burrow explains why
Article Text:
Trey Hendrickson ends holdout, Joe Burrow reacts (Image via: Getty Images)

Trey Hendricksonâ€™s contract standoff draws attention in Bengals camp

Joe Burrow reveals real reason behind the return



FAQs

Why did Trey Hendrickson hold out from Bengals training camp?

What was Trey Hendricksonâ€™s 4-word message after ending his holdout?

How did Joe Burrow react to Trey Hendricksonâ€™s return?

Why Trey Hendricksonâ€™s presence matters for Bengals

Cincinnati Bengals star defensive end Trey Hendrickson has ended his brief training camp holdout, but not without leaving fans and analysts buzzing. After skipping the first week of camp in a push for a contract extension, the All-Pro pass rusher returned with a blunt, four-word message: â€œNothing has really changed. â€ His statement perfectly captures the ongoing tension between star players seeking security and teams balancing their salary cap.Hendrickson, who turns 31 this season, is coming off a career-best 17.5 sacks, leading the NFL and cementing himself as one of the leagueâ€™s premier pass rushers. Despite his dominance, he remains without a new long-term deal and is seeking guaranteed money beyond the 2025 season.His brief absence was a clear signal to the Bengalsâ€™ front office, yet his return follows a growing NFL trend known as the â€œhold-inâ€â€”where players report to camp to avoid daily fines while still expressing contract frustrations.Quarterback Joe Burrow didnâ€™t sugarcoat the financial side of Hendricksonâ€™s decision to return. â€œGuys donâ€™t want to get finedâ€¦ itâ€™s 50K a day. Thatâ€™s not pennies. Thatâ€™s probably part of it,â€ Burrow said, highlighting the NFLâ€™s harsh penalty for holdouts. Burrow also stressed that Hendricksonâ€™s presence is invaluable for team chemistry, even if negotiations remain unsettled.â€œWhenever you can have a guy like that in the buildingâ€¦ itâ€™s good to see his face, good to have his presence.Heâ€™s going to play a big part of this team this year.â€Trey Hendrickson briefly skipped Bengals training camp to push for a contract extension and secure more guaranteed money beyond the 2025 season.After returning to Bengals camp, Trey Hendrickson said, â€œNothing has really changed,â€ signaling that his contract situation remains unresolved.Joe Burrow said it was good to have Hendricksonâ€™s presence back in the building and noted that avoiding $50,000 daily fines likely influenced his return.For Cincinnati, having Hendrickson back is critical as the team eyes another playoff run. His leadership and relentless pass-rushing ability are cornerstones of Lou Anarumoâ€™s defense. Even without a new deal, his decision to show up prevents further distractions and keeps the Bengalsâ€™ locker room focused on football.Also Read: "I donâ€™t mind adding more"â€”Brian Flores addresses Vikingsâ€™ interest in Christian Wilkins after Raiders release While â€œNothing has really changedâ€ on paper, Hendricksonâ€™s quiet return speaks volumes. His performance remains vital to Cincinnatiâ€™s Super Bowl aspirations, and the pressure is now on the Bengals to decide whether to lock in their defensive star before the season begins.
Article Summary: Cincinnati bengals star defensive end trey hendrickson has ended his brief training camp holdout. The all-pro pass rusher returned with a blunt, four-word message: â€œnothing has really changed. â€ his statement perfectly captures the ongoing tension between star players seeking security and teams balancing their salary cap.

Article Title: Mitch Marner begins a new chapter with the Vegas Golden Knights after his emotional departure from Toronto
Article Text:
Mitch Marner begins a new chapter with the Vegas Golden Knights ( Image Via Twitter)

Mitch Marnerâ€™s playoff struggles reignite criticism despite regular-season impact



[FULL Q&A] NHL forward Mitch Marner on becoming a Golden Knight

The blockbuster trade: Mitch Marner to Vegas Golden Knights

FAQâ€™s

Q1. Why did Toronto trade Mitch Marner?

Q2. Which team did Marner join in 2025?

Q3. How long was Mitch Marner with Toronto?

After about a decade in the Maple Leafs jersey, Mitch Marnerâ€™s career looks to take quite a dramatic turn as he prepares to skate for the Vegas Golden Knights. While the ride westward is undoubtedly a new and major chapter in his hockey career, it is also one that is very deeply personal to him. The Toronto native, having always grown up dreaming of a Stanley Cup that would be coming home to his place, is now hoping to work through a franchise that, on the other hand, has been hugely successful recently and has emerged as a very strong culture.Mitch Marner's 2025 playtime started with promise, but it soon deteriorated as the Toronto Maple Leafs failed to realize their championship dreams. Despite Marner putting up 13 points in the playoffs, he fell off the radar in Game 7 versus the Florida Panthers, as his side endured a gut-wrenching 6â€“1 loss, thus inviting all sorts of heavy criticism. Marner was visibly frustrated, even yelling at some teammates on the bench, a sight that only brought home to the powers that be the extent of his anguish as well as the expectations heaped upon him as the hometown hero.Assisting Auston Matthews for a Game 6 goal was a brief flurry of hope that could not revive Toronto's playoff run. Again, as the Leafs stumbled at this same round of the playoffs, Marner's moment in the postseason was overshadowed by an implosion from his teammates.These playoff performances, coupled with pressure from fans and media alike, seemed to spur talk of a new chapter.June 30, 2023: The Maple Leafs pulled off another high-level sign-and-trade. Mitch Marner signed an eight-year, $96 million extension with Toronto before being sent to Vegas in exchange for Nicolas Roy. For Marner, this was more than business, though-it was a welcome chance.He would later figure out why Vegas was absolutely on the top of his list. In Vegas, Marner said the emphasis lay on the winning atmosphere and culture of the team, and hence, in his eyes, there was much more to it than calling it an escape from Toronto's intense glare. There was a real opportunity to be a part of a roster that genuinely has a shot at lifting the Stanley Cup. He also added that, on a personal level, life in his new city suits his young family, so the decision was as much a family one as it was a business one.Also Read: Connor McDavidâ€™s wife Lauren McDavid joins Mark McMorris for the Frenchâ€‘side wedding adventure of Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins As Mitch Marner turns the page to join the Vegas Golden Knights, he shall take with him the teachings and the legacy of his years in Toronto. With new sights on a new horizon under another skyline, Marner will now chase the Stanley Cup in that city that knows how to win.Ans: The Maple Leafs had yet to make deep playoff runs, and pressure for change had been mounting. Toronto chose to give itself a fresh start through a sign-and-trade move.Ans: Marner was traded by the Maple Leafs and then sent to the Vegas Golden Knights.Ans: Mitch Marner had nine seasons in Toronto for the Maple Leafs from 2015 until 2025.
Article Summary: Mitch marner was traded by the toronto maple leafs and then sent to the vegas golden knights. Marner spent nine seasons in toronto for the maple leafs from 2015 until 2025. He signed an eight-year, $96 million extension with toronto before being sent to vegas in exchange for nicolas roy.

Article Title: Winnipeg Jets signs defenceman Dylan Samberg to a 3-year contract deal
Article Text:
(Image via X)

Dylan Samberg inks 3-year extension deal

Dylan Sambergâ€™s journey so far

Also Read

FAQs

Who is Dylan Samberg?

What is Dylan Sambergâ€™s current age?

On July 30, 2025, the Winnipeg Jets and defenseman Dylan Samberg reached an agreement on a 3-year contract extension. The club has announced the contract extension with an average annual value of US$5.75 million. According to multiple reports, Defenseman Samberg avoided a salary arbitration hearing and signed a three-year contract extension with the Winnipeg Jets on Wednesday.Samberg was drafted 43rd overall by the Jets in 2017 and has spent his entire professional career in Manitoba. He appeared in a total of 216 games for the Jets and 64 for the Manitoba Moose in the AHL. The 26-year-old NHL player recorded career-best totals in goals (six), points (20), and/plus-minus rating (plus-34) in 60 games last season. Besides, he added three assists in 13 playoff games. The Winnipeg Jets have signed defenceman Dylan Samberg to a three-year contract extension with an average annual value of US$5.75 million. Samberg made only 60 regular-season appearances last season, after playing a career-high 78 games with Winnipeg during the 2023â€“24 campaign, during which he was mostly productive overall.The 26-year-old averaged 21:08 of ice time and recorded six goals, 14 assists, 120 blocked shots, 56 hits, 26 PIM, and a plus-34 rating. According to Reuters, Dylan Samberg has totaled 51 points (nine goals, 42 assists) in 216 career games since being selected by Winnipeg in the second round of the 2017 NHL Draft.Moreover, the Winnipeg Jets also took to their X/Twitter account to share the contract extension with NHL fans. Announcing the inking of the deal, the team posted a poster of Dylan Samberg and wrote, â€œTHREE MORE YEARS OF SAMMY.â€Earlier, it was stated that he is only allowed to give a one-year deal as he is eligible for unrestricted free agency next summer. However, the player avoided the restriction and agreed to sign the contract with the Jets. It will be interesting to witness what new form he brings to the table in these three years. Dylan Samberg kicked off his professional journey in 2021 with the AHLâ€™s Manitoba Moose, where he managed to score one goal and dish out six assists over 32 games. After dealing with a high ankle sprain in September 2021, he bounced back to establish himself as a top-pair defenseman.He made his NHL debut with the Winnipeg Jets on January 13, 2022, and even notched an assist in that game. Samberg played six games in the NHL before heading back to the AHL, where he rose to prominence with 12 assists in another 32 games. Following his association with AHL in 2022, he joined the Winnipeg Jets and will continue to be a part of the team for three more years.Dylan Michael Samberg is an American professional ice hockey defenseman who is currently playing for the Winnipeg Jets of the National Hockey League. The player started his career with the AHLâ€™s Manitoba Moose. He made his NHL debut with the Winnipeg Jets on January 13, 2022.Dylan Samberg, born on 24 January 1999, is currently 26 years old. He was born in Hermantown, Minnesota.
Article Summary: The winnipeg jets have signed defenceman dylan samberg to a three-year contract extension with an average annual value of us$5.75 million. The 26-year-old nhl player recorded career-best totals in goals (six), points (20), and/plus-minus rating (plus-34) in 60 games last season.

Article Title: Yankee Stadium moment goes viral as young couple appear to engage in explicit s*x act during live game

The video, believed to be filmed during one of the afternoon matchups, shows a man in a Phillies jersey and cap seated beside a woman in jean shorts and a tank top. Captured from behind by another fan, the footage appears to show the couple engaging in a se*ual act, right in the middle of a crowded stadium section.Despite the absence of fans directly beside or behind the couple, they were well within view of dozens of nearby spectators. In the original clip, one stunned onlooker is heard saying, "This is fâ€”king insane." The incident happened in the bright light of day. The pair kept their eyes on the game while their hands told another story.A second version of the video surfaced shortly afterward, showing the woman becoming visibly more animated. The man then appears to place his finger in his mouth after the act, a moment that was called out by amused (and horrified) viewers. The stadium reaction was a mix of laughter and complete disbelief.Public se*ual encounters at ballparks are, surprisingly, not unheard of. In 2022, a couple was caught engaging in a similar act at an Oakland Athletics game. A decade earlier, two fans were found having s*x in the bathrooms at Yankee Stadium during a game against the Tampa Bay Rays. And just last year, OnlyFans model Kaylee Killion claimed she and her fiancÃ© had s*x in the parking lot during Super Bowl LVIII.As for the Yankees, they went on to win Sundayâ€™s finale 4-3, though the Phillies claimed the series overall. The team has yet to release a statement regarding the incident, and it remains unclear whether the couple involved will face any consequences. The original video was shared multiple times across different platforms racking up millions of views.Also Read: UFC commentator Joe Rogan slams violent medieval sport Calcio Storico still celebrated in Florence The New York Yankees were hosting the Philadelphia Phillies in a weekend series.No, the Yankees have not yet commented on the viral video.No, similar incidents have happened before, including at games in Oakland and New York.

Edmonton Oilers fans are feeling the weight of the offseason as Connor McDavid remains unsigned for a new contract. The Oilersâ€™ captain, currently in the final year of his eight-year, $100 million deal, has been eligible to sign an extension since July 1, yet no agreement has been reached. This delay is sparking speculation and fueling anxiety among fans about the franchiseâ€™s future.Oilers General Manager Stan Bowman recently addressed McDavidâ€™s contract status on Bob Staufferâ€™s â€œOilers Nowâ€ podcast, sharing a patient approach to the negotiations. Bowman confirmed that he has spoken to McDavidâ€™s agent, Judd Moldaver, but emphasized that the team is giving the superstar his space to decide his future.â€œHonestly, Iâ€™ve tried to give Connor his space,â€ Stan Bowman said. A lot of this is respecting the athlete and their timeline. So we haven't had any of those types of detailed discussions yet, but we certainly will. I donâ€™t have a timeline update, but I do expect to have some conversations with him soon and hopefully get that wrapped up.â€This statement reflects how cautious and respectful the Oilers are being with their franchise player.McDavid, 27, is not only the face of the team but also one of the NHLâ€™s most dominant players, regularly topping the league in scoring and driving Edmontonâ€™s playoff pushes. His next contract will be pivotal for the teamâ€™s Stanley Cup ambitions, shaping both the Oilersâ€™ roster and their competitive window.While Bowmanâ€™s calm approach may reassure some, the delay naturally raises questions. If McDavid waits deeper into the season to make a decision, rumors about free agency or the Oilersâ€™ ability to build a championship-caliber roster around him will only intensify. His eventual commitment or lack of it will impact not just Edmonton but the entire NHL landscape.Connor McDavid has been eligible to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers since July 1, 2025, as he enters the final year of his current eight-year, $100 million deal.Stan Bowman explained that the Oilers are giving McDavid space to decide, saying they have no set timeline but expect to have conversations soon to â€œhopefully get that wrapped up.â€McDavidâ€™s next contract will determine the Oilersâ€™ long-term Stanley Cup chances, impact their roster decisions, and could shape the entire NHL landscape.Also Read: Connor McDavid set to become NHLâ€™s highest-paid player with record-breaking Oilers contract extension before 2025-26 season, reveals Bob Stauffer For now, the hockey world waits. Connor McDavidâ€™s contract decision is the defining storyline of the Oilersâ€™ offseason, and every word from Stan Bowman carries weight for a fanbase dreaming of a Stanley Cup future.

Article Title: â€œA role from 30,000 feetâ€: Tom Brady distances himself from Las Vegas Raiders decisions in candid reveal
Article Text:
Tom Brady clears the air on rumors of controlling the Las Vegas Raiders' inner workings (Image credits: IG/X)

Tom Brady clears the air on rumors of controlling the Las Vegas Raidersâ€™ inner workings

He sees himself as a supportive mentor, not a hands-on decision-maker

Tom Bradyâ€™s focus is building culture and letting players and coaches shine

FAQs

1. How much ownership does Tom Brady have in the Raiders?

2. Is Tom Brady involved in Raiders player signings or coaching?

Tom Bradyâ€™s minority stake in the Las Vegas Raiders has sparked ongoing rumors about how involved he really is. Many NFL fans believe the former quarterback still pulls strings behind the scenes. His status as a football icon only adds to the suspicion. But Brady is now speaking upâ€”clearly and candidlyâ€”about his true role with the team.Thereâ€™s been a long-running belief that Brady holds quiet power in the Raidersâ€™ front office, but he says that couldnâ€™t be further from the truth. â€œI think people assume I have more influence than I really do,â€ he told Front Office Sports. While he does own a five percent stake, it comes without control over roster decisions or coaching calls.â€œIâ€™m not involved in daily decisions or whoâ€™s getting signed,â€ he explained. His involvement is not about managing contracts, trades, or strategy meetings. Thatâ€™s left to the official team executives. Brady wants fans to knowâ€”heâ€™s not pulling strings behind closed doors.Brady explained that his current role is more about guiding and inspiring than managing. â€œI feel like I can play a role from 30,000 feet to make sure the players are saying the right thing, the coaches are saying the right thing,â€ he said.His interest lies in the culture, not in the paperwork.â€œAnd I really enjoy that role, and I can play a mentorship role in different ways in a lot of different areas,â€ he added. Itâ€™s not about spotlight or power for him anymore. He finds meaning in uplifting others. That mindset marks a quiet evolution from superstar athlete to off-field leader.Even as a minority owner, Brady said he wants to be part of shaping a winning, respectful environment. â€œI enjoy the process and the product that happens on the field,â€ he said, showing his continued emotional tie to the game. But he doesnâ€™t want to interfere with those in the driverâ€™s seat.â€œThereâ€™s certainly business people involved in selling tickets and sponsorships and so forth,â€ he noted. His goal isnâ€™t to cross into business or sideline authority. Instead, he chooses to watch, encourage, and nudge from a respectful distance. Thatâ€™s where he feels he can now make the biggest difference.Even as he steps back from the front lines, Bradyâ€™s presence is still felt in quieter, lasting ways. Heâ€™s no longer drawing up plays or reading defensesâ€”but heâ€™s helping shape a mindset, a standard. From throwing touchdowns to guiding from above, Brady is still in the gameâ€”just playing it from a different field now. And for a legend who once thrived under pressure, this quieter chapter may be his most meaningful yet.Also read: â€œThis is toughâ€: Miami Dolphins CB Kader Kohou out for 2025 NFL season with knee injury, leaving secondary in crisis He holds a five percent minority stake in the franchise, which gives him no control over team operations.No. Brady confirmed he has no say in staff decisions, trades, or roster changes.
Article Summary: Tom brady clears the air on rumors of controlling the las vegas raiders' inner workings. He sees himself as a supportive mentor, not a hands-on decision-maker. Brady confirmed he has no say in staff decisions, trades, or roster changes. His interest lies in the culture, not in the paperwork.

Article Title: Cooper Flagg's Mom, Kelly Flagg, Reveals How She Raised the No. 1 NBA Draft Pick
Article Text:
Kelly Flagg and Cooper Flagg. Image via: Jacob Kupferman/Getty Images | Jared C. Tilton/Getty

Cooper Flagg

How a Basketball Legacy at Home Laid the Foundation for Cooper Flaggâ€™s Rise

Why Kelly Flaggâ€™s Personalized Parenting Approach Made All the Difference

Cooper Flagg. Image via: Getty Images

Instilling Relentless Competitiveness While Keeping Cooper Flagg Grounded

Balancing High-Stakes Pressure with Family Rituals, Humor, and Support

The Flagg Family Blueprint: How Love, Honesty, and Intentionality Built a Generational Talent

Whenwas selected as the No. 1 overall pick in the 2025 NBA Draft, the basketball world took noticeâ€”not just of his elite talent, but of the journey that brought him from a small town in Maine to the sportâ€™s biggest stage. While much of the spotlight now shines on Cooper, his rise canâ€™t be fully understood without recognizing the unwavering influence of his mother, Kelly Flagg. Her unique blend of athletic background, honest parenting, individualized focus, and humor became the foundation for a household built on grit, love, and excellence.Cooper Flaggâ€™s path to stardom didnâ€™t begin on hardwood at Duke or in front of NBA scoutsâ€”it started in a gym that felt more like home. Kelly Flagg (nÃ©e Bowman) wasnâ€™t just a supportive parent; she was a former star herself. At the University of Maine, she led her team to its first-ever NCAA tournament win in 1999 and later earned a spot in the schoolâ€™s Sports Hall of Fame. Cooperâ€™s father, Ralph, also played college basketball, making the sport a family affair.Their three childrenâ€”Hunter, Ace, and Cooperâ€”grew up immersed in the game. Basketball wasnâ€™t a hobby; it was woven into their everyday lives.Late-night shooting drills, family court battles, and dinner conversations all revolved around hoops. â€œI dreamt that my kids would be great basketball players,â€ Kelly once said with a laugh. â€œThatâ€™s why I married your dadâ€”he was tall. I thought I could get some tall basketball babies. â€But Kellyâ€™s parenting approach wasnâ€™t just about basketball. She believed in raising each of her kids as distinct individuals, tailoring her support to fit their personalities and needs. â€œIâ€™ve always been intentional about parenting them as individuals,â€ she explained. â€œEven though theyâ€™re both competitive, their mindsets and approaches are different. So we adjusted how we raised them accordingly.â€As both a coach and a mom, Kelly knew when to give tactical advice and when to offer emotional support. Game nights were emotionally taxingâ€”she often felt like she had played every minute alongside Cooper.A central trait that defines Cooper Flagg is his insatiable competitivenessâ€”a fire Kelly helped ignite and stoke from an early age. In the Flagg household, everything was a challenge. â€œHe doesnâ€™t accept anything less than being the best,â€ Kelly said. â€œWhether itâ€™s basketball or something small, he wants to dominate.â€But it wasnâ€™t just about winning. Kelly also grounded her children in realism and accountability. â€œIâ€™ve never sugarcoated anything,â€ she admitted. â€œIf their effort wasnâ€™t there, Iâ€™d tell them. I think being honest has helped them.â€Her straightforwardness paid off. Cooper embraced the grindâ€”working on fundamentals, staying late in the gym, and mastering the details, especially free throws. â€œTheyâ€™re called free for a reason,â€ Kelly would say, emphasizing the value of focus and repetition.As Cooperâ€™s fame grew, so did the pressureâ€”but Kelly made sure the family stayed rooted. Rituals like sitting in the same seat for games or sticking to quirky superstitions kept things lighthearted and familiar. She never lost her sense of humor, often joking about marrying for basketball genetics or poking fun at Cooperâ€™s rising status.More than anything, she maintained a strong emotional presence. No matter how high Cooper climbed, the Flagg family made it a priority to support one anotherâ€”on the court and beyond.Kelly Flagg never claimed to have a magic recipe for raising a superstar.
